articles.author: Adrian Brown
articles.title: Coronavirus: China under pressure as toll exceeds SARS
articles.description: Death toll on the mainland rises to 811 people as criticism grows over the leadershipâ€™s handling of the crisis.
articles.content:
The number of people killed by the coronavirus has risen to 811.
That is more than the death toll during the SARS epidemic 17 years ago.
All but two of the deaths are in China, where criticism is growing over a shortage of medical supplies and the leadershi… [+110 chars]

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: In Pictures: Life in Wuhan, coronavirus epicentre
articles.description: Millions of people are under lockdown in China's Hubei province in a bid to stop the deadly virus from spreading.
articles.content:
Authorities have all but shut down Wuhan, a city of 11 million and a major transport hub, as the death toll from the novel coronavirus outbreak surged past 800 in mainland China, overtaking global deaths during the 2002-2003 SARS epidemic. 
The total number … [+1015 chars]

articles.author: Michael Standaert
articles.title: China virus funeral order fuels upset as death toll exceeds SARS
articles.description: Experts say order that all victims cremated quickly and without a funeral unnecessary and adding to families' grief.
articles.content: Sichuan, China - Orders issued by China's top health authority for the swift cremation of the remains of coronavirus victims at facilities near the hospitals where they died appear to be an overreaction and unnecessary to curb the transmission of the disease,… [+6736 chars]

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: China virus death toll surges past 800, as infections mount
articles.description: Death toll on the mainland rises to 811 with two foreigners - a Japanese and an American - among the dead on Saturday.
articles.content:
The death toll in mainland China from the coronavirus surged to 811, the National Health Commission said on Sunday, as a Japanese and an American became the first foreigners to die of the illness in China.
The commission reported 89 deaths nationwide up to m… [+1462 chars]
